CatDescriptText: Howard Gardner, retired worker, Carrick, and Allan Bierman, commercial salesman, Squirrel Hill, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 8, 1960, pg. 33 with question: "In your opinion, which political party, Republican or Democratic, has the best record of keeping its campaign pledges to the people of the United States?  Which party do you think would be most successful in carrying out its 1960 campaign platform-this being a Presidential election year?"  Mr. Gardner's answer reads: "The Democrats have done better...And Kennedy is all right, because he's on the Roosevelt side in his earnestness and sincerity...These words come from a non-Catholic...Kennedy has sufficinet [sufficient] experience and will stick to the platform."  Mr. Bierman's answer reads: "Both parties try to live up to their respective platforms, but they fall short on their pledges the specific clarifications of their respective planks."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Howard Gardner wearing patterned necktie with tie tack, standing in front of building with RAAB Clothing sign in background, Wood Street, Downtown; Portrait of Allan Bierman wearing dark suit jacket and eyeglasses, standing in front of store window
